programme.title: WNBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Semifinal Game 2: Phoenix Mercury at Minnesota Lynx
programme.desc: Phoenix Mercury at Minnesota Lynx in Game 2 of a best-of-five semifinal series. From Target Center. Minnesota showed why it is the top seed in an 82-69 Game 1 win, shrugging off a seven-point halftime defecit and pulling away in the fourth quarter behind Courtney Williams' game-high 23 points, seven assists and five steals. Fellow ninth-year guard Kahleah Copper's 22 points led the Mercury.

programme.title: WNBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Semifinal Game 2: Indiana Fever at Las Vegas Aces
programme.desc: Indiana Fever at Las Vegas Aces in Game 2 of a best-of-five semifinal series. From Michelob Ultra Arena. League MVP A'ja Wilson (6 for 22 shooting) and the Aces try to shrug off a stunning 89-73 loss in Game 1 to the injury-plagued Fever, who were carried by veteran guard Kelsey Mitchell's 34 points in her first-ever semifinal game.

programme.desc: This comprehensive documentary investigates the infamous moment when spectator Steve Bartman deflected a foul ball during a 2003 Chicago Cubs playoff game and became the target of angry fans when the Cubs lost not only the game but the series. Gibney also compares the event to the notorious World Series error made by Boston Red Sox first baseman Bill Buckner.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 2: Indiana Pacers at New York Knicks
programme.desc: Indiana Pacers at New York Knicks in Game 2 of the Eastern Conference finals. From Madison Square Garden. New York trails 1-0 after squandering the opener in overtime to a relentless Pacers squad headlined by hot-shooting Aaron Nesmith (eight threes, 30 points). Indiana erased a 14-point deficit in the final three minutes of regulation and had a 27-4 edge in points off turnovers. The Knicks are 3-4 at MSG this postseason.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 3: New York Knicks at Indiana Pacers
programme.desc: New York Knicks at Indiana Pacers in Game 3 of the Eastern Conference finals. Rick Carlisle's Pacers come home on Indy 500 Day looking to pull away from the Knicks after grinding out wins in the first two games in New York City. Ninth-year forward Pascal Siakam exploded for 39 points in Game 2, while Jalen Brunson's 39.5 ppg and eight assists/game have not been enough for the Knicks, who now look to build on their 5-1 road record this postseason.

programme.desc: From 1992: Portland at Chicago in Game 2 of the NBA Finals. The Blazers won 115-104 (OT), tying the series 1-1. In the loss, Michael Jordan netted 39 points in 50 minutes.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.sub-title: 2024: Los Angeles Lakers at Atlanta Hawks
programme.desc: Los Angeles Lakers at Atlanta Hawks. From Fri. Dec. 6, 2024.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 4: New York Knicks at Indiana Pacers
programme.desc: New York Knicks at Indiana Pacers in Game 4 of the Eastern Conference finals. Tom Thibodeau's Knicks try to level the series at 2-2 in a building where they won for the first time in 10 playoff tries two nights ago, rallying from 20 points down behind airtight defense and a 20-point fourth quarter outburst by Karl-Anthony Towns. Indy shot 5-of-25 on threes and scored only 42 second-half points in the loss.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 5: Indiana Pacers at New York Knicks
programme.desc: Indiana Pacers at New York Knicks in Game 5 of the Eastern Conference finals. From Madison Square Garden. Up 3-1, Rick Carlisle's Pacers are one win from capturing this matchup of Finals-starved teams both looking to end a quarter century away from the championship series. Tyrese Haliburton led Indy's offensive revival in a 130-121 Game 4 triumph, totaling 32 points, 15 assists and 12 rebounds, with no turnovers.

programme.title: NB80's
programme.desc: Highlighting the NBA in the 1980s. Featured: The intense Magic Johnson-Larry Bird rivalry; introduction of the 3-point shot.

programme.title: NB80's
programme.desc: The NBA in the 1980s is highlighted. Featured: the Lakers become known as "Showtime"; Moses Malone reaches the Promised Land; a look at head coaches and their attire.

programme.title: NB80's
programme.desc: Highlighting the NBA in the 1980s. Featured: Larry Bird and Magic Johnson continue to battle for league titles and MVPs; Spud Webb secures a spot in All-Star history; and Dr. J says goodbye.

programme.title: Basketball Stories
programme.desc: Stephen Curry, Damian Lillard, Jaylen Brown, Jason Kidd, and Gary Payton celebrate the Bay Area's profound influence on basketball, exploring how the region's innovation and resilience shaped legends and its lasting impact on the game's culture.

programme.title: NBA Hardwood Classics
programme.sub-title: 2024: Indiana Pacers at Boston Celtics Game 1
programme.desc: From 2024: Indiana Pacers at Boston Celtics in Game 1 of the Eastern Conference finals. Jayson Tatum and the Celtics opened their sixth conference finals in eight years, looking to improve on a 1-4 record in those seres. Indiana had dropped its last three conference finals, in 2004, 2013 and 2014. Boston had a 4-2 mark in postseason series vs. the Pacers, last meeting in 2019.

programme.title: NBA Hardwood Classics
programme.sub-title: 2024: Boston Celtics at Indiana Pacers Game 3
programme.desc: From 2024: Boston Celtics at Indiana Pacers in Game 3 of the Eastern Conference finals. Rick Carlisle's Pacers dragged a 2-0 series defecit back to Indianapolis, where they were 6-0 in the 2024 postseason, winning by 14.7 ppg. Jaylen Brown equaled his playoff-high of 40 points in Boston's 126-110 Game 2 win.

programme.title: NBA Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: From 1993: Seattle at Phoenix in Game 5 of the Western Conference finals. Charles Barkley scored 43 points en route to a triple-double as the Suns took a 3-2 series lead. Shawn Kemp had 33 points in the loss.

programme.title: NBA Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: The 1993 All-Star Game in Salt Lake City. The West beat the East 135-132 in OT. Karl Malone and John Stockton were named co-MVPs in front of their home fans.

programme.title: NBA Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: From 1993: Orlando at Chicago. The Magic held off the Bulls 128-124 in overtime at Chicago Stadium despite 64 points from Michael Jordan. Scott Skiles tallied 31 for Orlando.

programme.title: NBA Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: From 1993: Boston at Charlotte in Game 4 of an Eastern Conference first-round series.

programme.sub-title: 2024: Milwaukee Bucks vs. Oklahoma City Thunder
programme.desc: 2024: Milwaukee Bucks vs. Oklahoma City Thunder.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 6: New York Knicks at Indiana Pacers
programme.desc: New York Knicks at Indiana Pacers in Game 6 of the Eastern Conference finals. From Gainbridge Fieldhouse. Up 3-2, Tyrese Haliburton and the Pacers remain one win away from their second-ever NBA Finals, coming home to a court where they are 10-1 all-time vs. New York in the playoffs. After allowing 43 first-quarter points here in Game 4, the Knicks held Indy to 45 in the first half in taking Game 5 by 17 points.

programme.title: NBA Finals
programme.sub-title: Game 1: Indiana Pacers at Oklahoma City Thunder
programme.desc: Indiana Pacers at Oklahoma City Thunder in Game 1 of the best-of-seven NBA championship series. From Paycom Center. Tyrese Haliburton paces potent Indiana in its first Finals in 25 years, while league MVP and fellow guard Shai Gilgeous-Alexander stars for a deep, defense-minded OKC squad. The Thunder's 68 regular-season wins to Indy's 50 marks the largest difference in an NBA Finals since 1981, when Boston (62 wins) took out Houston (40) in six games.

programme.title: NBA Hardwood Classics
programme.sub-title: 2024: Minnesota Timberwolves at Dallas Mavericks Game 4
programme.desc: From 2024: Minnesota Timberwolves at Dallas Mavericks in Game 4 of the Western Conference finals. Up 3-0, Jason Kidd's Mavs tried to finish off Minnesota to clinch their third Finals appearance and first since 2011. Kyrie Irving and Luka Doncic tallied 33 points each in a 116-107 Game 3 win, with Doncic contributing five steals and Daniel Gafford adding three blocks.

programme.title: NBA Hardwood Classics
programme.sub-title: 2024: Dallas Mavericks at Minnesota Timberwolves Game 5
programme.desc: From 2024: Dallas Mavericks at Minnesota Timberwolves in Game 5 of the Western Conference finals. Karl-Anthony Towns (25 points) and the T-Wolves returned home down 3-1 to Dallas after rediscovering their touch in a 105-100 must-have Game 4 victory. Luka Doncic (triple double) had little help in the loss, though his Mavs still have three shots at advancing to their first Finals since 2011.

programme.title: NBA Hardwood Classics
programme.sub-title: 2024 Finals Game 5: Dallas Mavericks at Boston Celtics
programme.desc: Dallas Mavericks at Boston Celtics in Game 5 of the 2025 NBA Finals. The Celtics came home with a 3-1 series lead, one victory away from a record 18th NBA title, while Dallas looked to sustain its edge from an emphatic 122-84 win in Game 4. Jayson Tatum and Jaylen Brown combined for just 25 points in the loss, while Mavs star Luka Doncic netted 29, to go with three steals.

programme.title: NBA Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: From 1993: Seattle at Phoenix in Game 5 of the Western Conference finals. Charles Barkley scored 43 points en route to a triple-double as the Suns took a 3-2 series lead. Shawn Kemp had 33 points in the loss.

programme.title: NBA Hardwood Classics
programme.sub-title: 1994: Chicago Bulls at New York Knicks
programme.desc: From 1994: Chicago at New York. The Knicks had double-digit scoring from five players, led by Patrick Ewing's 20 points, in an 86-68 win over Chicago.

programme.title: NBA Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: From 1994: Denver at Seattle in Game 5 of a first-round playoff series. The Nuggets stunned Seattle 98-94 in overtime to take the series and make the Sonics the first top seed to lose to an eighth seed in the opening round.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.sub-title: 2025: New York Knicks at Oklahoma City Thunder
programme.desc: New York Knicks at Oklahoma City Thunder. From Fri. Jan. 3, 2025.

programme.title: NBA Finals
programme.sub-title: Game 2: Indiana Pacers at Oklahoma City Thunder
programme.desc: Indiana Pacers at Oklahoma City Thunder in Game 2 of the NBA Finals. From Paycom Center. OKC has had two off days to process an excruciating 111-110 loss in Game 1, punctuated by Tyrese Haliburton's last-second 21-foot jumper, his fourth dramatic game-winning shot of these playoffs. Indiana weathered 24 turnovers (to the Thunder's six) and withstood 38 points from MVP Shai Gilgeous-Alexander.

programme.title: NBA Finals
programme.sub-title: Game 3: Oklahoma City Thunder at Indiana Pacers
programme.desc: Oklahoma City Thunder at Indiana Pacers in Game 3 of the NBA Finals. From Gainbridge Fieldhouse. The best-of-seven series is knotted 1-1 entering this first Finals game in Indianapolis since 2000, with Larry Bird as Pacers coach. His former teammate Rick Carlisle looks to slow Shai Gilgeous-Alexander (36 ppg in Finals) and an OKC squad that rolled 123-107 in Game 2, controlling the boards 43-35 after Indiana built a 17-rebound edge in taking Game 1.

programme.title: NBA Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: From 1993: Seattle at Phoenix in Game 5 of the Western Conference finals. Charles Barkley scored 43 points en route to a triple-double as the Suns took a 3-2 series lead. Shawn Kemp had 33 points in the loss.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Texas Tech (3-0) at Utah (3-0) in a Big 12 opener. From Rice-Eccles Stadium. Senior QB Behren Morton (923 yards, 11 TDs, 1 INT) leads the Red Raiders' bid for a second straight win over a former Pac-12 squad after downing Oregon State. Sophomore DE John Henry Daley heads the pursuit for Utah, who boast a dual-threat QB in New Mexico transfer Devon Dampier (7 TDs, 0 INTs, 66 rushing ypg). The teams last met in 1973.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: North Carolina (2-1) at UCF (2-0). From FBC Mortgage Stadium. Bill Belichick's Tar Heels take another shot a Big 12 team after opening with a blowout loss to TCU. Linebackers Andrew Simpson (Boise State transfer) and Mikai Gbayor (Nebraska) backbone the UNC defense against UCF running backs Jaden Nixon and Myles Montgomery. This is the first-ever meeting.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Iowa (2-1) at Rutgers (3-0) in a Big Ten opener. From SHI Stadium. Max Llewellyn and Jaden Harrell are senior leaders in the Iowa front seven looking to disrupt Scarlet Knights QB Athan Kaliakmanis and RB Antwan Raymond of an offense honed vs. MAC and MEAC foes. The Hawkeyes are 4-0 in the all-time series.

programme.title: CFL Football
programme.desc: Week 16 in the CFL begins with the Alouettes (6-7) heading down the 405 to face the Argonauts (5-8). Montreal has won both meetings with Toronto this year, but both were at home. Argos quarterback Nick Arbuckle leads the CFL with 4,089 passing yards.

programme.title: CFL Football
programme.desc: The Stampeders return from their final bye in 2025 ready to face the Lions. BC went 2-1 versus Calgary in 2024, with the host winning each match. Nathan Rourke threw for 308 yards and created two touchdowns as BC beat Ottawa 38-27 in Week 15.

programme.title: CFL Football
programme.sub-title: Winnipeg Blue Bombers at Ottawa Redblacks
programme.desc: The Blue Bombers (6-7) try to snap a three-game skid when they visit the Redblacks (4-9). In Week 11, Ottawa erased a 17-point fourth-quarter deficit, but Winnipeg claimed a 30-27 victory on a 47-yard field from Sergio Castillo as time expired.

programme.title: CFL Football
programme.desc: The East-leading Tiger-Cats (8-5) play host to the Elks (5-8) in the Electric City. Hamilton picked up a 28-24 victory over Edmonton in Alberta on Aug. 2. Bo Levi Mitchell (HAM) lit up Edmonton for 350 passing yards and three TDs, two to Tim White.

programme.title: Formula 1 Racing
programme.desc: The Formula One series moves on from Europe and runs the Azerbaijan Grand Prix on the Baku streets. Max Verstappen ended a run of McLaren dominance with a win at the Italian Grand Prix on Sept. 7. McLaren's Oscar Piastri won this race in 2024.
